trans.ptxt: If a high-strength steel part ( MPa or higher) is MAG welded, the welding wire used must have a tensile strength equal to, or greater than, the lowest tensile strength of the parts being welded.
NOTE: Avoid MAG welding for high-strength steel ( MPa) parts.

entry.ptxt: Welding wire applicable to the high-strength steel sheet with a tensile strength of MPa
Example: Bosch Automotive Service Solutions solid wire (SSJ-DS980J)

trans.ptxt: NOTE: For details concerning the welding wire, confirm the product specifications issued by the welding wire manufacturer.

trans.title: Sheet thickness vs. plug hole diameter; unit: mm (in)
